name: SuperCorners
readme_summary: SuperCorners is a macOS application that enhances the built-in Hot Corners feature by adding more trigger zones along screen edges and enabling a wider range of actions. It allows users to launch applications, run scripts, open files, and execute system commands directly from these enhanced screen zones, boosting productivity.
key_features: Additional trigger zones on screen edges
primary_use_case: To provide an enhanced and more versatile alternative to macOS's built-in Hot Corners feature, allowing users to trigger a wide variety of actions from additional zones on their screen edges for increased productivity.
cover_image_prompt: A 3D isometric illustration of a modern, minimalist desk setup. The four corners of the main monitor are subtly glowing, and small, distinct icons representing different actions (an app icon, a script symbol, a folder, a globe) are emanating from these glowing corners. A stylized hand is shown moving towards one of these corners, triggering a cascade of digital particles that form a small, organized workflow diagram. The SuperCorners app icon is subtly integrated into a small UI element on the desk. The overall mood is one of effortless productivity and streamlined control, with a clean, bright color palette and soft, ambient lighting.

name: manim-video-generator
description: This application allows you to generate mathematical animations using natural language descriptions. It uses OpenAI's GPT model to convert your descriptions into Manim code, which is then used to create beautiful mathematical animations.
readme_summary: This repository provides a web-based tool that generates mathematical animations from natural language descriptions. It leverages OpenAI's GPT models to translate text prompts into Manim code, which then renders complex mathematical visualizations.
key_features: Generate mathematical animations from text descriptions
Real-time code preview with syntax highlighting
primary_use_case: To enable users to create mathematical animations by simply describing them in natural language, abstracting away the complexity of Manim coding.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old alchemist in a dimly lit laboratory, holding a glowing scroll with simple text written on it. Before the alchemist, a complex 3D mathematical equation is materializing out of thin air, shimmering with digital energy. The alchemist's hands are guiding the transformation, with streams of light flowing from the scroll to the equation. Small, stylized UI elements showing code snippets and a preview window are subtly integrated into the lab's shelves. The scene is rendered in a detailed, magical realism style with a focus on the contrast between the simple input (scroll) and the complex output (animation), with a warm, inviting glow emanating from the magical transformation. The repository name 'Manim Video Generator' is subtly etched onto a nearby workbench.

name: WiFiAudioStreaming-Desktop
description: A desktop application for streaming audio over a local network. It allows you to stream your computer's internal audio to any device on the network. Developed in Kotlin and Jetpack Compose.
readme_summary: WiFiAudioStreaming-Desktop is a Kotlin application that transforms your computer into a wireless audio transmitter or receiver. It enables streaming of your PC's internal audio to other devices on the local network, or receiving audio from them, with features like automatic discovery and configurable audio settings.
primary_use_case: Streaming computer audio wirelessly over a local network to other devices.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, friendly robot holding a glowing audio wave emanating from a laptop. The audio wave is visibly traveling across a clean, modern room towards a smartphone and a tablet, which are depicted as receiving the sound with subtle musical notes. The robot is pointing towards the laptop, indicating it as the source. Small, translucent UI elements showing connection status and audio settings float around the scene. The overall mood is seamless connectivity and ease of use, rendered in a vibrant, 3D isometric illustration style with a soft, inviting color palette.

name: komari
readme_summary: Komari is a lightweight, self-hosted server monitoring tool that provides a web interface for viewing server status and collects data via a lightweight agent. It prioritizes low resource consumption and user data privacy.
primary_use_case: Monitoring server performance and status through a web interface.
cover_image_prompt: A vigilant lighthouse keeper on a cliffside, tending to a powerful lighthouse that beams light across a stormy sea. The lighthouse's beam illuminates various ships (representing servers) in the distance, showing their status with subtle color cues (green for stable, red for issues). Small, glowing data streams flow from the ships towards the lighthouse, symbolizing data collection. In the keeper's hand, a small, stylized monitor displays a simplified dashboard. The scene is set at dusk with dramatic lighting, emphasizing the protective and watchful nature of the tool. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with clean lines and a focus on clarity.

name: go-agent
description: An agent framework for Go with graph-aware memory, UTCP-native tools, and multi-agent orchestration. Built for production.
readme_summary: The go-agent repository provides a framework for building AI agents in Go, offering features like pluggable LLM providers, tool calling, RAG-powered memory, and multi-agent coordination. It is designed for production use with a focus on performance and idiomatic Go interfaces.
primary_use_case: Building production-ready AI agents in the Go programming language.
cover_image_prompt: A Go Gopher character acting as a conductor, orchestrating a symphony of diverse AI agents (represented by different stylized robots and entities). Each agent is performing a specific task, with visual cues showing them receiving instructions (glowing data streams) and producing outputs (e.g., charts, text, code snippets). In the background, a subtle graph-like structure represents the agent's memory and coordination system. Small, stylized UI elements and code snippets are integrated into the scene to hint at the software nature. The overall style is a clean, vibrant 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clear visual communication of coordination and modularity.

name: Jauth
description: Lightweight SSL/TLS reverse proxy with authorization(via Telegram and SSH) for self-hosted apps
readme_summary: Jauth is a Go-based, single-binary reverse proxy that secures self-hosted applications with SSL/TLS encryption and flexible user authorization via SSH or Telegram. It simplifies access management with optional Single Sign-On (SSO) and minimal configuration, making it ideal for protecting web services.
key_features: Single binary executable with no dependencies
SSL/TLS encryption using autogenerated self-signed certificates or Let's Encrypt
User authorization via SSH or Telegram
Security for bloated and vulnerable modern applications
Doesn't use any Telegram bot API
primary_use_case: Securing self-hosted applications with SSL/TLS and user authorization.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, glowing digital keyhole representing Jauth, with two distinct pathways leading to it: one path is a secure, encrypted tunnel (SSL/TLS) and the other is a stylized SSH connection. From the keyhole, a single, clean beam of light shines onto a cluster of diverse, simplified application icons (e.g., a blog, a dashboard, a file server). Subtle digital particles flow from the applications towards the keyhole, representing secure access requests. The background is a dark, secure vault-like environment. The overall mood is secure and streamlined. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with a clean, modern aesthetic and a color palette of blues, purples, and subtle greens.
